package com.msi.multithread;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Comparator;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Map.Entry;

public class App {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		Employee e1 = new Employee("Roshan",1);
		Employee e2 = new Employee("Subiksha",12);
		Employee e3 = new Employee("Kumar",9);
		Employee e4 = new Employee("Tharun",22);
		Employee e5 = new Employee("Abiram",32);
		
		Map<Integer,Employee> empMap = new HashMap<Integer,Employee>();
		
		empMap.put(1, e1);
		empMap.put(2, e2);
		empMap.put(3, e3);
		empMap.put(4, e4);
		empMap.put(5, e5);
		System.out.println("Before Sort:");
		System.out.println(empMap);
		
		//Set<Entry<Integer,Employee>> setMap = empMap.entrySet();
		
		List<Entry<Integer,Employee>> listSort = new ArrayList<Entry<Integer,Employee>>(empMap.entrySet());
		listSort.sort(new Comparator<Entry<Integer,Employee>>() {

			@Override
			public int compare(Entry<Integer, Employee> o1,
					Entry<Integer, Employee> o2) {
				// TODO Auto-generated method stub
				return o1.getValue().getEmpName().compareTo(o2.getValue().getEmpName());
			}
			
		});
		
		Map<Integer,Employee> sortedMap = new LinkedHashMap<Integer, Employee>();
		for (Entry<Integer, Employee> entry : listSort) {
			sortedMap.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
		}
		
		System.out.println("After Sort:");
		System.out.println(sortedMap);
		
	}
}

class Employee{
	private String empName;
	private int empNo;
	
	
	public Employee(String empName, int empNo) {
		super();
		this.empName = empName;
		this.empNo = empNo;
	}
	public String getEmpName() {
		return empName;
	}
	public void setEmpName(String empName) {
		this.empName = empName;
	}
	public int getEmpNo() {
		return empNo;
	}
	public void setEmpNo(int empNo) {
		this.empNo = empNo;
	}
	
	@Override
	public String toString() {
		return "Employee [empName=" + empName + ", empNo=" + empNo + "]";
	}
	
	
	
}
